intro: Wigginsia rubricostata, commonly known as the red-costated bryophyte, is a unique plant belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive reddish coloration along the costa of its leaves, which gives it its common name. This moss thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions. Its structure consists of closely packed, wiry stems with small, overlapping leaves. Wigginsia rubricostata plays a vital role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitats.
